value.note_summary: Rigid therapeutic bronchoscopy with tumor destruction, right mainstem stent revision, additional tumor/mechanical debridement and tunneled pleural catheter placement for malignant obstruction and effusion; codes 31641, 31636, 31645 and 32550 are all supported, with no separate diagnostic bronchoscopy or pericardial code billed per IP coding guidance.
comments: Pericardial window was performed by cardiothoracic surgery and is not coded on the IP claim; bronchoscopy codes already include the diagnostic component.
CPT selection and 2025 facility RVUs/payments are aligned with interventional pulmonology coding guidance in ip_coding_billing.v2_7 and national RBRVS values.

value.note_summary: Despite concatenated text from a prior rigid bronchoscopy case, the portion pertaining to Mary Jackson describes a flexible bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage for pneumonia under moderate sedation with native airway and no pleural or ablation work; therefore only 31624 is appropriate and registry pleural/ablation fields are reset.
comments: General anesthesia, rigid bronchoscopy, ablation and tunneled catheter details in the leading text belong to the prior Okafor case and should not drive registry fields for this diagnostic BAL.
Registry sedation_type adjusted to Moderate and airway_type to Native to match the documented midazolam/fentanyl conscious sedation without an artificial airway.

value.note_summary: EBUS-TBNA of mediastinal and hilar lymph node stations 4R, 7 and 10R for lung cancer staging under moderate sedation with a native airway; three nodal stations makes 31653 the correct single EBUS code and 31652 is not separately reported per EBUS coding guidance.
comments: Airway_type is corrected from Tracheostomy to Native because no tracheostomy or artificial airway is documented in the procedure description.
EBUS code is only billed once per session; separate codes for individual stations are not used.

value.note_summary: Therapeutic bronchoscopy with cryoablation of a peripheral left upper lobe adenocarcinoma under general anesthesia with ETT and radial EBUS guidance; this is captured by 31641 alone, with no separate diagnostic or EBUS staging code.
comments: Ablation_duration_seconds and ablation_max_temp_c recorded in the registry are consistent with multiple freeze–thaw cycles described in the report.

value.note_summary: Combined general-anesthesia case with EBUS-TBNA of mediastinal/hilar nodes, Ion robotic navigation to a right lower lobe mass, transbronchial lung biopsy and radial EBUS evaluation. Final coding uses 31653 for ≥3 nodal stations plus 31627 (navigational bronchoscopy), 31654 (radial EBUS add-on) and 31628 (transbronchial lung biopsy).
comments: 31652 is not billed in addition to 31653 because 31653 already describes EBUS with sampling of 3 or more mediastinal/hilar nodal stations in a single session.
Ion robotic navigation and radial EBUS are separately reportable with 31627 and 31654 when performed in addition to EBUS nodal staging and transbronchial lung biopsy.

value.note_summary: Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS evaluation, transbronchial lung biopsies and EMN planning for a single peripheral lung lesion; no mediastinal EBUS nodal staging is documented. Codes 31627, 31654, 31628 and 31626 together describe the navigational planning, guidance and transbronchial sampling performed.
comments: Sedation and airway are not explicitly documented; registry values of Moderate sedation and Native airway are retained rather than assuming general anesthesia in the absence of clear charting.

value.note_summary: Deep-sedation bronchoscopy with EBUS-TBNA of two nodal stations and electromagnetic navigation–guided transbronchial lung biopsy of a single lobe nodule; coding with 31652 for 1–2 nodal stations plus 31628 for transbronchial lung biopsy is appropriate.
comments: Navigation hardware is EMN (not robotic), and there is no separate fiducial or dye marking; 31626 is not billed because only navigated biopsy is described.

value.note_summary: EBUS bronchoscopy under general anesthesia with sampling of multiple mediastinal and hilar lymph node stations (e.g., 2R, 2L, 4R, 4L, 7, 10R, 10L, 11R, 11L) to evaluate granulomatous disease; this meets criteria for 31653 (3 or more nodal stations) as the single EBUS code.
comments: Although the registry airway_type is Tracheostomy, the note documents general anesthesia with paralytic and positive-pressure ventilation, which can be consistent with either ETT or tracheostomy; no clear contradiction is present so the registry value is left unchanged.

value.note_summary: Ultrasound-guided therapeutic thoracentesis with removal of 1.5 L of serosanguinous pleural fluid under local anesthesia only; no chest tube placement or pleurodesis was performed. CPT 32555 alone is appropriate, and registry pleurodesis flags are turned off.
comments: Pleurodesis_performed is set to false and pleurodesis_agent to null because the procedure description and follow-up plan do not describe any sclerosant instillation.
